description: Defines how the questionnaire answers resource is used to reflect form data within the ONC's Structured Data Capture standard. : Structured Data Capture Data Capture

element.name: StructuredDataCaptureAnswers
element.short: A structured set of questions and their answers
element.formal: A structured set of questions and their answers. The questions are ordered and grouped into coherent subsets, corresponding to the structure of the grouping of the underlying questions.
element.requirements: To support structured, hierarchical registration of data gathered using digital forms and other questionnaires.

element.formal: The version specific identifier, as it appears in the version portion of the url. This values changes when the resource is created, updated, or deleted.
element.comments: The server assigns this value, and ignores what the client specifies, except in the case that the server is imposing version integrity on updates/deletes.

element.short: When the resource version last changed
element.formal: When the resource last changed - e.g. when the version changed.
element.comments: This value is always populated except when the resource is first being created. The server / resource manager sets this value; what a client provides is irrelevant.

element.short: Profiles this resource claims to conform to
element.formal: A list of profiles that this resource claims to conform to. The URL is a reference to Profile.url.
element.comments: It is up to the server and/or other infrastruture of policy to determine whether/how these claims are verified and/or updated over tiem.

element.short: Security Labels applied to this resource
element.formal: Security labels applied to this resource. These tags connect specific resources to the overall security policy and infrastructure.
element.comments: The security labels can be updated without changing the stated version of the resource.

element.formal: Tags applied to this resource. Tags are intended to to be used to identify and relate resources to process and workflow, and applications are not required to consider the tags when interpreting the meaning of a resource.
element.comments: The tags can be updated without changing the stated version of the resource.

element.short: A set of rules under which this content was created
element.formal: A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content.
element.comments: Asserting this rule set restricts the content to be only understood by a limited set of trading partners. This inherently limits the usefulness of the data in the long term. However the existing health eco-system is highly fractured, and not yet ready to define, collect, and exchange data in a generally computable sense. Wherever possible, implementers and/or specification writers should avoid using this element as much as possible.

element.formal: The base language in which the resource is written.
element.comments:
Language is provided to support indexing and accessibility (typically, services such as text to speech use the language tag). The html language tag in the narrative applies  to the narrative. The language tag on the resource may be used to specify the language of other presentations generated from the data in the resource

Not all the content has to be in the base language. The Resource.language should not be assumed to apply to the narrative automatically. If a language is specified, it should it also be specified on the div element in the html (see rules in HTML5 for information about the relationship between xml:lang and the html lang attribute).

element.short: Text summary of the resource, for human interpretation
element.formal: A human-readable narrative that contains a summary of the resource, and may be used to represent the content of the resource to a human. The narrative need not encode all the structured data, but is required to contain sufficient detail to make it "clinically safe" for a human to just read the narrative. Resource definitions may define what content should be represented in the narrative to ensure clinical safety.
element.comments: Contained resources do not have narrative. Resources that are not contained SHOULD have a narrative.

element.formal: These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope.
element.comments: This should never be done when the content can be identified properly, as once identification is lost, it is extremely difficult (and context dependent) to restore it again.

element.short: Unique id for this set of answers
element.formal: A business identifier assigned to a particular completed (or partially completed) questionnaire.
element.requirements: Used for tracking, registration and other business purposes.

element.formal: Indicates the Questionnaire resource that defines the form for which answers are being provided.
element.requirements: Needed to allow editing of the questionnaire in a manner that enforces the constraints of the original form.

element.formal: The lifecycle status of the questionnaire answers as a whole.
element.requirements: The information on questionnaires  may possibly be gathered during multiple sessions and altered after considered being finished. Questionnaires with just questions may serve as template forms, with the applicable publication statuses.

binding.name: QuestionnaireAnswersStatus
binding.description: Lifecycle status of the questionnaire answers

mapping.map: .statusCode (also whether there's a revisionControlAct - and possibly mood to distinguish "in progress" from "published)
.statusCode (also whether there's a revisionControlAct - and possibly mood to distinguish "in progress" from "published)

element.formal: The subject of the questionnaire answers.  This could be a patient, organization, practitioner, device, etc.  This is who/what the answers apply to, but is not necessarily the source of information.
element.requirements: Must know the subject context.

element.short: Person who received and recorded the answers
element.formal: Person who received the answers to the questions in the QuestionnaireAnswers and recorded them in the system.
element.comments: Mapping a subject's answers to multiple choice options and determining what to put in the textual answer is a matter of interpretation.
element.requirements: Need to know who interpreted the subject's answers to the questions in the questionnaire, and selected the appropriate options for answers.

element.short: Identifies when this version of the answer set was created.  Changes whenever the answers are updated.
element.formal: Identifies when this version of the answer set was created.  Changes whenever the answers are updated.
element.comments: May be different from the update time of the resource itself, because that is the status of the collection and authoring.
element.requirements: Clinicians need to be able to check the date that the information in the questionnaire was collected, to derive the context of the answers.

element.short: The person who answered the questions
element.formal: The person who answered the questions about the subject. Only used when this is not the subject him/herself.
element.requirements: When answering questions about a subject that is minor, incapable of answering or an animal, another human source is used to answer the questions.

element.short: Primary encounter during which the answers were collected
element.formal: Encounter during which this set of questionnaire answers were collected. When there were multiple encounters, this is the one considered most relevant to the context of the answers.
element.requirements: Some institutions track questionnaires under a specific encounter.

element.name: group
element.formal: A group of questions to a possibly similarly grouped set of questions in the questionnaire answers.
element.comments: The Questionnaire itself has one "root" group with the actual contents of the Questionnaire.
element.requirements: Need to be able to logically group answers to grouped questions.

constraint.name: GroupHaveSubOrQuestions
constraint.human: Groups may either contain questions or groups but not both

element.formal: Identifies the group from the Questionnaire that corresponds to this group in the QuestionnaireAnswers resource.
element.requirements: Groups can repeat in the answers, so a direct 1..1 correspondence may not exist - requiring correspondence by id.

element.formal: Text that is displayed above the contents of the group.
element.comments: On the root group, this is the title of the questionnaire.
element.requirements: When including text for the questionnaire with the answers, sections may have a section header.

element.formal: Additional text for the group, used for display purposes.
element.requirements: When including text for the questionnaire, each section may contain additional explanations are background text.

element.short: The subject this group's answers are about
element.formal: More specific subject this section's answers are about, details the subject given in QuestionnaireAnswers.
element.requirements: Sometimes a group of answers is about a specific participant, artifact or piece of information in the patient's care or record, e.g. a specific Problem, RelatedPerson, Allergy etc.

element.formal: A sub-group within a group. The ordering of groups within this group is relevant.
element.requirements: Reports can consist of complex nested groups.

element.formal: Set of questions within this group. The order of questions within the group is relevant.
element.requirements: Must register answers to questions.

element.formal: Identifies the question from the Questionnaire that corresponds to this question in the QuestionnaireAnswers resource.
element.requirements: Groups can repeat in the answers, so a direct 1..1 correspondence may not exist - requiring correspondence by id.

element.short: Text of the question as it is shown to the user
element.formal: Text of the question as it is shown to the user.
element.requirements: When including text for the questionnaire, each question may contain its actual question display text.

element.formal: The respondent's answer(s) to the question.
element.comments: We nest the value because we can't have a repeating structure that has variable type.

element.formal: Single-valued answer to the question.
element.comments: More complex structures (Attachment, Resource and Quantity) will typically be limited to electronic forms that can expose an appropriate user interface to capture the components and enforce the constraints of a complex data type.  Additional complex types can be introduced through extensions.
element.requirements: Need to be able to retain a single-valued answer to a question.

element.formal: Nested group, containing nested question for this question. The order of groups within the question is relevant.
element.requirements: It is useful to have "sub-questions", questions which normally appear when certain answers are given and which collect additional details.
